definition: Land formations shaped by natural processes without human development or cultivation.

positive_examples: The Amazon rainforest spans across multiple countries in South America.
Sahara desert temperatures can reach extreme highs during the day.
Prairie grasslands stretch endlessly across the Great Plains.
Dense jungle vegetation made exploration nearly impossible.
The oasis provided fresh water for weary desert travelers.
Rolling hills of the piedmont region offer scenic mountain views.
negative_examples: The city park has well-maintained walking paths and benches.
Farmers planted corn across hundreds of acres of farmland.
The highway cuts straight through the valley between mountains.
Suburban neighborhoods filled the former wheat fields.
Golf courses require constant irrigation and landscaping maintenance.
The mining operation stripped away the topsoil completely.
training_hints.disambiguation: Not to be confused with: UrbanAreas, AgriculturalLand, DevelopedProperty, TransportationRoutes
